titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend to the principal campaign committee of any candidate for elective public office the same graduated tax rates which apply to the principal campaign committee of a candidate for Congress.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to apply the special rule for principal campaign committees on graduated tax rates to candidates for any Federal, State, or local elective public office. (Currently, such rule applies only to congressional candidates.)
